definitions.definition: A light roofed structure used as a shelter in a public place .
A structure, sometimes temporary , erected to house exhibits at a fair , etc.
The building where the players change clothes, wait to bat, and eat their meals.
examples: Only one player has hit a six over the Lord's pavillion .

definitions.definition: A detached or semi-detached building at a hospital or other building complex .
The lower surface of a brilliant - cut gemstone , lying between the girdle and collet .
The cartiliginous part of the outer ear ; auricle .
The fimbriated extremity of the Fallopian tube .

subdefinitions.definition: A flag or ensign carried at the gaff of the mizzenmast .

definitions.definition: An ornate tent , used either as a charge or bearing, or surrounding a shield as or atop the mantling .
A covering ; a canopy ; figuratively, the sky .

secondary_definitions: A light roofed structure used as a shelter in a public place .
A structure, sometimes temporary , erected to house exhibits at a fair , etc.
( cricket ) The building where the players change clothes, wait to bat, and eat their meals.
A detached or semi-detached building at a hospital or other building complex .
The lower surface of a brilliant - cut gemstone , lying between the girdle and collet .
( anatomy ) The cartiliginous part of the outer ear ; auricle .
( anatomy ) The fimbriated extremity of the Fallopian tube .
( military ) A flag , ensign , or banner .
( heraldry ) An ornate tent , used either as a charge or bearing, or surrounding a shield as or atop the mantling .
A covering ; a canopy ; figuratively, the sky .
